title: Crypto prices today: Bitcoin, Ethereum, altcoin rates - 2 Nov, 2023 - latest rates - SAMAA
content:
Photo: File

In today's cryptocurrency market, optimism abounds, with a sea of green dominating on Thursday, November 2.

Investors are eagerly awaiting the Federal Reserve's upcoming meeting, which could either fuel the ongoing crypto rally or potentially dampen market sentiment.

The Federal Reserve's recent announcement was met with applause from the market.

During Wednesday's FOMC meeting, the central bank decided unanimously to maintain its benchmark interest rates at their current levels, keeping the key federal funds rate within the 5.25%-5.5% target range, where it has remained since July.

Notably, this decision followed a series of 11 rate hikes, including four in 2023.

Crypto enthusiasts have much to celebrate as Bitcoin's price experienced a 2.77% increase, reaching $35,363.40, and its trading volume surged by 60.64% to $25.03 billion over the last 24 hours.

The market cap also received a boost of 2.80%, reaching $690.77 billion. Over the past week, Bitcoin's price has appreciated by over 2%.

Ethereum's price didn't lag behind, with a 2.29% increase, now trading at $1,846.22, accompanied by a 66.85% rise in one-day volume, reaching $11.38 billion.

Simultaneously, XRP's price also saw a 3.24% rise, landing at $0.606, while its 24-hour volume decreased by 14.42% to $1.87 billion.

Among other prominent cryptocurrencies, Solana's price surged by 9.94% to $41.82, while Cardano's price witnessed a 6.42% jump, with trading volumes rising by 151.41% and 13.46% to $3.74 billion and $357.96 million, respectively.

Even meme coins joined in on the optimism, with Dogecoin's price increasing by 2.62% to $0.06889, although with a 0.23% decrease in trading volume to $483.85 million.

On the other hand, Shiba Inu's price surged by 3.53% to $0.000007959, with trading volume up 5.58% from the previous day, reaching $169.30 million.

These gains across major cryptocurrencies contributed to a notable upswing in the overall crypto market.

The global cryptocurrency market cap rose by 2.85% from the previous day, reaching $1.31 trillion, with a market fear and greed index reading of 74, indicating a "greed" sentiment.

The total market cap increased by 43.49% in the last 24 hours, now standing at $57.9 billion.

The crypto market's surge underscores the growing interest in digital assets, with all eyes on the Federal Reserve's forthcoming stance, set to have a significant impact on the market's future trajectory.

title: Here’s How High AI Predicts Ethereum Price Will Go After the Next Halving - CoinCodex
content:
Key takeaways

Ethereum (ETH) price is expected to reach new all-time highs in Q2 2024, following the next Bitcoin halving event

The Bitcoin halving occurs approximately every four years and has historically ushered in a new bull market for blockchain-based digital assets

ETH rose +2133% after the previous BTC halving to reach its all-time high of $4864, Sporia on TradingView expects a similar level of upside this time around

Here’s how high AI predicts Ethereum price will go after next halving

Ethereum (ETH) is currently valued at $1788 after dropping -2.67% in the past 24 hours. This follows a period of upside in which ETH climbed +23.22% over the course of a 3-week period at the end of October.

The recent surge from ETH means that it has now reclaimed the 50% level on its July-October range in a single bullish move. So far, ETH has held up well at the range’s midway point and early forecasts are suggesting that the positive price action could continue over the coming months.

The ETH price prediction algorithm has forecasted a +253% move by Q2 2024. This would place ETH at $6,339 — a new all-time high for the second-largest cryptocurrency by market cap. The main catalyst for the projected move is the Bitcoin (BTC) halving event, where the total mining rewards in each BTC block are cut in half.

What is Bitcoin halving and when is it due to happen?

The Bitcoin halving event occurs every 210,000 blocks, which works out to approximately every four years. The process of reducing the blockchain’s total mining rewards by half provides a greater level of deflationary pressure — after each halving event, the current circulating supply for BTC becomes increasingly scarce.

When each block miner was awarded 12.5 BTC, the circulating supply increased by 1,800 BTC each day. After the 2020 halving event, each block miner was then awarded with 6.25 BTC, which meant that there were just 900 BTC being created each day. As a result, the proportion of the circulating supply that is newly mined is continually reduced, making those that are already in circulation more scarce, and in theory, more valuable.

Bitcoin’s deflationary mechanism has historically ushered in a new bull market for blockchain-based digital assets. BTC formed new all-time highs in 2013, 2017, and 2021 — approximately one year after a halving event took place. Right now, the next Bitcoin halving event is expected to occur on 15th April 2024.

How high could ETH go after the next halving event?

ETH shot up +2133% in total after the previous BTC halving. The move cemented Ethereum’s position as the second-most valuable cryptocurrency by market cap, taking the ecosystem’s native token from $217 to $4,864 in a period of 18 months.

A trader who goes by the username Sporia on TradingView shared a long-term projection for the price of ETH. The chart highlights two parallel channels in which ETH has been trading since the 2018 alt season, including a strong support line that has been held throughout the bear market of 2022 and 2023.

The reversal indicator signal has fired off just 4 times in ETH’s history, each time preceding a massive rally. Image source: TradingView (@Sporia)

Sporia expects that ETH will continue to hold this market structure over the next 5 years. The upper resistance line provides the ETH price target during the next two bull stages of Bitcoin’s 4-year cycles, including a $16,090 price target in 2025. In total, this would be a +799% price increase from the current level.

Bottom line: AI sets bullish near-term target for ETH and long-term outlook remains positive

ETH has been a relative straggler during recent bullish moves in the crypto markets, climbing +60% while the total crypto market cap climbed +80% over the past year. The relative underperformance of ETH during this time frame has increased Bitcoin dominance to more than 50%, which in itself is a metric that has historically heralded a fresh period of upside for the entire crypto market.

The slight underperformance from ETH in recent times should not be a cause for concern. The network was upgraded during the bear market as Ethereum’s consensus mechanism changed from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake during The Merge, which helped make the blockchain more energy efficient.

ETH also benefits from new ETFs and a degree of regulatory clarity from the SEC. On top of that, Ethereum’s various layer-2s have been making major progress in isolation and each one provides an increasing level of buy pressure for the native ETH token.

To summarize, there are plenty of bullish catalysts for ETH, and it seems only a matter of time before the digital asset starts gaining momentum. As things stand, the ETH price prediction algorithm expects a +253% move in the next 7 months, which would take ETH to a new all-time high just 2 months after the next BTC halving event.

title: When Is The Next Crypto Bull Run Expected? [2024 or 2025?] - Captain Altcoin
content:
Home » Investing The Dawn of the Next Crypto Bull Run: When and Why? InvestingJournal The Dawn of the Next Crypto Bull Run: When and Why? Torsten Hartmann

The cryptocurrency market, known for its volatility, is a realm of digital assets that has seen periods of exponential growth, often referred to as ‘bull runs’.

As we stand on the precipice of a potential surge, it’s crucial to understand the factors that could trigger this event, the key players that might lead the charge, and the strategies to navigate this dynamic market.

Quick summary: crypto bull run prediction Topic Description 📊 Driving Factors Several factors could potentially drive the next crypto bull run: demand and supply, market news sentiment, institutional adoption, economic and political factors, and scarcity of alternative investment. 🌐 Ethereum’s Role and Layer 2 Solutions Ethereum is a major player in the crypto market and is preparing for significant changes, including layer 2 solutions like Arbitrum and Optimism, to improve scalability and reduce transaction costs. 🔮 Looking to the Future The upcoming development of zkevm in the Ethereum ecosystem could further improve scalability, making Ethereum an even more attractive platform for developers and users. ⏰ Challenge of Timing the Crypto Market Timing the cryptocurrency market can be challenging, but traders and investors use strategies like technical analysis, fundamental analysis, sentiment analysis, and market economy analysis to time the market more effectively. ❄️ Crypto Winter and Anticipation of a New Bull Run The recent crypto winter saw a significant drop in cryptocurrency prices, but there are signs of recovery with Bitcoin and Ethereum prices recently surging. 📅 What Year is the Next Bull Run in Crypto Historical price trends and market cycles suggest that the next crypto bull market may commence in the first half of 2024, following the subsequent Bitcoin halving, and reach its zenith in 2025.

The Driving Factors

Several factors could potentially drive the next crypto bull run:

Demand and Supply: The interest of investors and traders can influence the demand for crypto assets, leading to an increase or decrease in prices. Market News Sentiment: Partnerships, optimistic bulletins, new projects, or technology roll-outs that draw investors’ interest will usually increase the asset’s price. Institutional Adoption: This signifies the utility of cryptocurrency, which could cause a ripple effect on retail users to hop on mainstream adoption. Economic and Political Factors: Economy development and political stability help advance cryptocurrency adoption and increase financial inclusion. Scarcity of Alternative Investment: Slow-moving or low-return assets are less popular during uncertainty, resulting in a surge for higher-volatility, high-return assets like crypto. As the demand increases, the price of crypto will naturally increase too. Inflation and Interest Rate: Higher interest rates typically mean it is easier for an investor with spare cash to invest in speculative and riskier assets like a high-liquidity cryptocurrency.

Ethereum’s Role and the Impact of Layer 2 Solutions

Ethereum, a major player in the crypto market, is gearing up for significant changes. Ethereum’s founder, Vitalik Buterin, has emphasized the need to solve Ethereum’s scaling issues before the next bull run. He warns that if these issues are not addressed, a spike in on-chain activity could result in Ethereum users being hit with sky-high transaction fees.

To address these scaling issues, Ethereum and its community have been developing and implementing Layer 2 solutions such as Arbitrum and Optimism. These solutions are designed to increase the blockchain’s capacity, thereby improving the scalability of Ethereum and reducing transaction costs. This improvement in scalability and reduction in costs could lead to increased adoption of Ethereum, potentially driving the next bull run.

Looking to the future, zkEVM is an upcoming development in the Ethereum ecosystem. This technology could further improve the scalability of Ethereum, making it an even more attractive platform for developers and users.

The majority of crypto development and innovations happen on Ethereum, and these improvements in scalability could lead to even more development and innovation on the platform. This could create a positive feedback loop, with increased development and innovation leading to increased adoption, which in turn could drive the next bull run.

The Challenge of Timing the Crypto Market

Timing the cryptocurrency market can be challenging as prices fluctuate rapidly and unpredictably. However, there are several strategies that traders and investors deploy to time the market more effectively. These include technical analysis, fundamental analysis, sentiment analysis, and market economy analysis. While these strategies can provide some insights, it’s important to remember that there is no 100% accuracy for market prediction.

Read also:

The Crypto Winter and the Anticipation of a New Bull Run

The recent crypto winter, which saw a significant drop in cryptocurrency prices, has led to speculation about the start of a new bull run. However, predictions vary, with some experts suggesting that the crypto winter may extend into 2023 or even 2026. Despite this, there are signs of recovery, with Bitcoin and Ethereum prices recently surging in Q3 and Q4 of 2023.

What year is the next bull run in crypto?

Forecasting the precise moment of the upcoming cryptocurrency bull market is a complex task due to the market’s inherent volatility. Nevertheless, historical price trends and market cycles suggest that the next crypto bull market may commence in the first half of 2024, following the subsequent Bitcoin halving, and reach its zenith in 2025, as per coincheckup.com.

The Bitcoin halving event, which transpires approximately every four years, slashes the block reward for miners by 50%. Historically, this event has resulted in a heightened scarcity of Bitcoin, potentially driving up prices as demand surpasses supply, according to coincheckup.com.

Additional factors that could precipitate a new crypto bull market include:

Market sentiment and hype: Positive news, endorsements from prominent figures, and increased media exposure can generate a hype cycle, thereby instigating a bull market, as noted by coincheckup.com. Adoption and acceptance: The widespread embrace of cryptocurrencies by mainstream financial institutions, businesses, and governments can set off a bullish trend, as highlighted by coincheckup.com. Technological advancements: Innovations in blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies can pique investor interest, as stated by coincheckup.com.

However, it is crucial to acknowledge that the cryptocurrency market is subject to a myriad of influences, and accurately predicting the onset of the next bull market is virtually impossible. Consequently, it is vital to diligently monitor market trends and indicators, and base investment decisions on these insights.

For those gearing up for the next crypto bull market, a long-term investment strategy is recommended, coupled with a diversified investment portfolio and thorough fundamental analysis to gauge the growth potential of cryptocurrencies, as advised by coincheckup.com.

It is important to remember that past performance is not indicative of future results, and investing in cryptocurrencies carries risks. Always conduct your own research and consider consulting a financial advisor prior to making investment decisions.

While the timing of the next crypto bull market remains uncertain, with varying opinions among experts, some posit that the bull market has already commenced in 2023. Others forecast that the next Bitcoin bull run will kick off post the Bitcoin halving in 2024, reaching its peak in late 2025. Some traders even speculate that the bull run could materialize as early as 2024. Regardless of the differing viewpoints, it is imperative to recognize the cryptocurrency market’s volatility and unpredictability. Hence, investors should always conduct their own research and make informed decisions that align with their risk tolerance and investment objectives.

Strategies for the Next Bull Run

Identify Underrated Projects: One approach to anticipating the next bull run is to identify underrated projects that have the potential to gain significant traction. This strategy implies that the next bull run may occur when enthusiasm for the overall market is at a low point, creating opportunities for undervalued projects to shine. Focus on Fundamentals: Instead of focusing solely on meme coins and gambling for quick gains, investors should consider targeting projects with strong fundamentals. By analyzing the underlying technology, use cases, and potential growth prospects, individuals can identify cryptocurrencies that have a higher likelihood of achieving substantial returns. NFTs and the Growth Sector: Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) may play a significant role in the next bull run, potentially emerging as the largest growth sector. NFTs have gained considerable attention and adoption in recent years, attracting both artists and investors. If the trend continues, the growing interest in NFTs could contribute to the overall market momentum and trigger the next significant upswing in the crypto market. On-Chain Trading and Edge Development: On-chain trading allows individuals to gain insights from blockchain data, enabling a deeper understanding of market dynamics. Although new traders may initially experience losses, gaining experience and knowledge can prove highly rewarding when new money flows into the market during the next bullish phase. Web2 to Web3 Transition: The integration of blockchain technology into traditional internet applications could attract a wider user base, generating increased interest and investment in the crypto market. Therefore, the emergence of innovative Web3 applications might serve as a catalyst for the next market upswing.

In conclusion, the anticipation for the next crypto bull run is high, with various factors expected to drive this surge. However, it’s important for investors to do their own research and understand the risks involved in the volatile crypto market. The dawn of the next crypto bull run could be just around the corner, and those who are prepared stand to reap the most benefits.
